body:
This issue is copied from https://github.com/google/process.dart/issues/73

---

The readme of `packages/process` talks about:

> Comes with a record-replay implementation out-of-the-box, making it super easy to test code that spawns processes in a hermetic way.

but I couldn't find any info about it except that it was removed. Why was that? Will it be re-added at some point? Or should the readme simply be adjusted?

See also:

https://github.com/google/process.dart/pull/47

body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues)
- [X] I have read the [guide to filing a bug](https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports)

### Use case

A black `X` appears below markers when dragging them. This is controlled by `google.maps.MarkerOptions.crossOnDrag` on `Google maps V3.54`.

### Proposal

Implement support for the [`google.maps.MarkerOptions.crossOnDrag`](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/javascript/reference/marker#MarkerOptions.crossOnDrag) API.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create new flutter project.
2. Copy paste code below into main.dart and import image_picker:1.0.4 package. Update pod repo and run on iOS simulator 15.4.
3. Click FabActionButton to pick image from gallery.
4. Code runs on all iOS versions.
5. Now add 'google_maps_flutter: ^2.5.0' to pubspec.yaml.
6. Update the iOS pods (delete podfile.lock, Pods folder and run repo-update).
7. Run the project and pickImage again.
8. Error - PlatformException(invalid_source, Invalid media source., null, null)

### Expected results

Image should get picked and show in the screen.

### Actual results

The code with google_maps package works on iOS 17 devices but fails on 14 and 15 versions.

### Code sample

Code sample

```dart
import 'dart:io';

import 'package:flutter/material.dart';
import 'package:image_picker/image_picker.dart';

void main() {
  runApp(const MyApp());
}

class MyApp extends StatelessWidget {
  const MyApp({super.key});

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return const MaterialApp(
      title: 'Image Picker Demo',
      home: MyHomePage(title: 'Image Picker Example'),
    );
  }
}

class MyHomePage extends StatefulWidget {
  const MyHomePage({super.key, this.title});

  final String? title;

  @override
  State createState() => _MyHomePageState();
}

class _MyHomePageState extends State {
  File? imageFile;
  String? _pickImageError;

  final ImagePicker _picker = ImagePicker();

  Future pickImage() async {
    try {
      final XFile? pickedFile =
          await _picker.pickImage(source: ImageSource.gallery);
      setState(() {
        imageFile = File(pickedFile!.path);
      });
    } catch (e) {
      setState(() {
        _pickImageError = e.toString();
      });
    }
  }

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
      appBar: AppBar(
        title: Text(widget.title!),
      ),
      body: Column(
        mainAxisAlignment: MainAxisAlignment.center,
        children: [
          if (imageFile != null) Image.file(imageFile!),
          Center(child: Text(_pickImageError ?? 'Pick Image'))
        ],
      ),
      floatingActionButton: FloatingActionButton(
        onPressed: pickImage,
        heroTag: 'image0',
        tooltip: 'Pick Image from gallery',
        child: const Icon(Icons.photo),
      ),
    );
  }
}

```

Logs

```console
PlatformException(invalid_source, Invalid media source., null, null)
```

title: packages pointer_interceptor test fails

body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues)
- [X] I have read the [guide to filing a bug](https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports)

### Steps to reproduce


1. Install Flutter version 3.16.0-6.0.pre.10 

2. Clone the Flutter packages repository: git clone [GitHub - flutter/packages: A collection of useful packages maintained by the Flutter team](https://github.com/flutter/packages) 

3. Navigate to the packages/pointer_interceptor/example directory: cd packages/pointer_interceptor/example

4. Run the command flutter pub get

5. Run the command: flutter drive \                        
  --driver=test_driver/integration_test.dart \
  --target=integration_test/widget_test.dart \
  -d chrome >> pointer_interceptor-logs.txt

### Expected results

Running all tests should succeed. 
Note: This test works as expected with the latest stable (3.13.6)

### Actual results

The following test fails.

title: inaccurate error text shown when a non-null non-list is provided for `assets` section for a deferred component in pubspec

labels.name: tool
labels.description: Affects the "flutter" command-line tool. See also t: labels.

labels.name: P3
labels.description: Issues that we currently consider unimportant

labels.name: team-tool
labels.description: Owned by Flutter Tool team

labels.name: triaged-tool
labels.description: Triaged by Flutter Tool team

body:
Consider this pubspec manifest:

```yaml
name: test
dependencies:
  flutter:
    sdk: flutter
flutter:
  deferred-components:
    - name: blah
      assets: blah
```

Notice that, under the first and only deferred component, `assets` has a string value rather than a list.
In this case, the tool will print an error: `Expected "assets" key in the 0 element of "deferred-components" to be a list, but got blah (String).` However, the value is not a list, so the error is inaccurate.

Interestingly, providing `assets: blah` directly under flutter results in more accurate error text: `Expected "assets" to be a list, but got blah (String).\n` This is a result of us using completely separate parsing and validation code for parsing the top-level `assets` section and the `assets` sections under any deferred components.

https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/9644aa8d76475185352994f241ce152acd75a8fa/packages/flutter_tools/test/general.shard/flutter_manifest_test.dart#L1444-L1463

title: WIP feat: Introduce TightWrap

labels.name: framework
labels.description: flutter/packages/flutter repository. See also f: labels.

body:
**WIP! But feedback regarding the approach is very welcome.**

As a potential solution for #136154 and #135301, I've added a `TightWrap` Widget that changes the layout algorithm of `Wrap` when laying out the wrapped child.

The new algorithm checks if the child should be layout with `tightConstraints`.
If that's the case, the algorithm checks, if the child min intrinsic size in the main axis direction fits the current run. If it does, the child is layout with constraints, that fit in the current run.

Fix #136154 
Fix #135301

body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues)
- [X] I have read the [guide to filing a bug](https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports)

### Use case

I'm creating an app with a lot of Textfields on a single page. Most of them show Autocomplete options with RawAutocomplete. When the Autocomplete drop-out is open, the user is unable to really navigate the page. The user is unable to close the Autocomplete without the textfield losing focus or selecting an option:

![image](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/assets/109872040/dd10295b-60da-4c6d-a80e-eb98eb4c593f)


### Proposal

There should be an option to hide the drop-down in-app. The options should re-appear when the user starts typing again.

Looking at the code, there are only four criterias defined: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/901077bf0ed5c4280cc749c6906c85f42b356b6c/packages/flutter/lib/src/widgets/autocomplete.dart#L327-L329

1. `_userHidOptions` is true
2. Textfield is in focus
3. Nothing is selected
4. There are options available

Criteria 3 & 4 are used for the normal function of Autocomplete and not relevant here.

Criteria 2 can be used, but leads to odd behavior: The complete textfield loses focus, and the keyboard disappears.

The remaining one is `_userHidOptions`. It looks like this is doing exactly what I want: the options are hidden, but the focus remains, and the options re-appear once the user starts typing again.

It is set to true by `_hideOptions()`, which is triggered by a  `DismissIntent` (ESC key is pressed). Unfortunately, you cannot send the event properly yourself from the `fieldViewBuilder` func.

It would be great if a callback or similar can be integrated to trigger a similar to behavior like `_hideOptions()` does.

body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues)
- [X] I have read the [guide to filing a bug](https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports)

### Use case

Flutter has `Listenable`, `ChangeNotifier` and `ValueNotifier`. It's a common need to allow object to have listeners and notify them. It has applications in pure Dart code without Flutter.

I personally want to use it in my package that loads data from network and notifies when the next batch is loaded. If used in a Flutter app, it can be listened to by `AnimatedBuilder`, and so it must implement `Listenable`, which is Flutter-only. But my package has no other Flutter dependencies and can be used in CLI or server apps.

So far I use a `Stream` of events in the object. In pure Dart, the stream can be listened to. In Flutter, a `StreamBuilder` can be used to rebuild things on the events. But the complexity of streams over a simple `ChangeNotifier` is redundant.

### Proposal

Move `Listenable`, `ChangeNotifier`, `ValueNotifier`, etc. to a separate package that can be used without Flutter. Make Flutter depend on it.
